oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Soldiers; Heroes; Rifles; Military training; Firearms
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Fentress County (Tenn.); World War, 1939-1945 -- Tennessee -- History; United States -- Selective Service System
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sergeant Alvin C. York shows a Selective Service registrant Wilba Reid how to handle a rifle.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tennessee. Dept. of Conservation
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During World War II, York served as Chairman of the Fentress County Draft Board, signed up with the Signal Corps and the Tennessee State Guard, and took part in bond tours, recruitment drives, and camp inspections. Fentress County registered 3,703 men from Oct. 16, 1940 through March 31,1947. The Fentress County Draft Board consisted of York, Jess W. Evans, William H. Sewell, and William H. Voiles. Dr. J. P. Sloan was the examining physician.
